properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 1 at 2:16PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
Rapid changes in water levels of the Missouri River from Misty
Waters Marina up through Price are still occurring. The collecting
of ice in the river has been, and will continue to cause rising
water upstream of the leading edge of stationary ice. As of early
New Year's day, the upstream edge of stationary ice is just south
of Double Ditch Historical Site, or just under two miles north of
Hoge Island. Over the next 24 hours, the river will run out of
mobile ice and what has been a northward advancing ice cover will
quickly turn into a southward retreat as the warmer weather over
the next few days results in the loss of ice and lower water
levels. Regrettably, cooler weather next week suggests that the
area is likely to see yet another icing event late in the first
full week of January.

NWSheadline: NEW YEAR'S UPDATE ON MISSOURI RIVER ICE
